content.body: It's checking that the *comments* in the mechanization match the text of the spec.
content.formatted_body: It's checking that the comments in the mechanization match the text of the spec.

content.body: There's still the question of whether the mechanization's 'code' matches its comments.
Under "Conclusion", they say "we found one place with an incorrect comment (thankfully, the Coq code was correct!)" Which suggests that the Coq code *didn't* match the comment.
content.formatted_body: Under "Conclusion", they say "we found one place with an incorrect comment (thankfully, the Coq code was correct!)" Which suggests that the Coq code didn't match the comment.

content.body:
> <@jmdyck:matrix.org> There's still the question of whether the mechanization's 'code' matches its comments.

well if they could do *that*, they could have a fully automated mechanisation
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @jmdyck:matrix.org
There's still the question of whether the mechanization's 'code' matches its comments.
well if they could do that, they could have a fully automated mechanisation

content.body: not necessarily - I can imagine a scenario where a human produces the Coq code, and then software checks that it matches the spec pseudocode. But generating the Coq code from the spec might be easier.
